item.title: 【Albums (lossy)】Dolby Atmos - Yello - Point (Dolby Atmos Edition) [Dolby Atmos E-AC3-JOC | 16-bit/48kHz | 5.1 | 768 kb/s]
item.description:
Genre: Electronic, Pop
Style: Electro, Future Jazz
Year: 2020
Source: Blu-ray

"Point" is the fourteenth studio album by the Swiss electronic duo Yello. It was released on 4 September 2020 on Universal Music. Since 1979, the meticulous studio perfectionist Boris Meier and the brilliant improvisation of bohemian Dieter Meier stands for electronic soundscapes with charm and charisma. This album once again sums up the qualities of the two very different Yello characters: Swiss precision craftsmanship meets state-of-the-art sound and wonderfully free-thinking pop art.

Yello's sound is mainly characterized by unusual music samples, a heavy reliance on rhythm and Dieter Meier's dark voice. Yello makes heavy use of sampling in the construction of rhythm tracks and rarely uses samples from previously released music. Nearly every instrument has been sampled and re-engineered by Boris Blank, who over the years has built up an original sample library of thousands of named and categorized sounds.
Among their best known singles are "Oh Yeah" (1985), which has appeared in many films and television shows including Ferris Bueller's Day Off, The Secret of My Success, Uncle Buck and The Simpsons; and "The Race" (1988), which peaked at number 7 on the UK Singles Chart.

Tracklist
01. Waba Duba (03:07)
02. The Vanishing Of Peter Strong (03:22)
03. Way Down (03:19)
04. Out Of Sight (03:03)
05. Arthur Spark (03:35)

08. Core Shift (03:00)
09. Spinning My Mind (03:19)
10. Hot Pan (03:17)
11. Rush For Joe (03:25)
12. Siren Singing (03:43)
Bonus Tracks
13. Insane (03:49)
14. Zephyr Calling (03:16)
15. Meet My Angel (03:48)

Release Info
The source is of this release is the lossless Dolby Atmos track from the Blu-ray.
Encoded to "Dolby Digital Plus with Dolby Atmos" with Dolby Media Encoder (282 MB).
You can download the lossless "Dolby TrueHD with Dolby Atmos" version here (1.69 GB).
